message: Error Generated Due to Framework -DataSourceException Exception
Input provided by user is invalid. Please check. <exception>
Error detected while interacting with DataSource  <exception>

Unsupported Data Source, Chimera is supporting MS SQL Server, Oracle, PostgreSQL, Maria DB, MY SQL & Snowflake Databases as well as Parquet / Avro / Csv / Json / Delta / Iceberg / Cobol / Excel(XLSX) / ORC File Formats
File Not Found Exception  <exception>
Multiple File found with same pattern or name  <exception>
only YML, JSON, avsc,and jsd schema supported  <exception>
UNCAUGHT_EXCEPTION
Invalid schema, accepted schema is yml or Json format  <exception>
Error occurred while reading from data source  <exception>
Error Occurred while writing to data source  <exception>
API Exception
Bad Request: The server could not understand the request due to invalid syntax <exception>.  <exception>
Unauthorized: The client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.  <exception>
Payment Required: Reserved for future use. <exception>
Forbidden: The client does not have access rights to the content. <exception>
Not Found: The server can not find the requested resource. <exception>
Method Not Allowed: The request method is known by the server but is not supported by the target resource. <exception>
Not Acceptable: The server cannot produce a response matching the list of acceptable values. <exception>
Proxy Authentication Required: The client must authenticate itself with a proxy.  <exception>
Request Timeout: The server would like to shut down this unused connection.  <exception>
Conflict: The request conflicts with the current state of the server.  <exception>
Gone: The requested content has been permanently deleted from the server.  <exception>
Length Required: The server refuses to accept the request without a defined Content-Length header.  <exception>
Precondition Failed: The client has indicated preconditions in its headers which the server does not meet.  <exception>
Payload Too Large: The request entity is larger than limits defined by server.  <exception>
URI Too Long: The URI requested by the client is longer than the server is willing to interpret.  <exception>
Unsupported Media Type: The media format of the requested data is not supported by the server.  <exception>
Range Not Satisfiable: The range specified by the Range header field in the request can't be fulfilled.  <exception>
Expectation Failed: The expectation given in the request's Expect header could not be met.  <exception>
I'm a teapot: This code was defined in 1998 as one of the traditional IETF April Fools' jokes.  <exception>
Unprocessable Entity: The request was well-formed but unable to be followed due to semantic errors.  <exception>
Too Early: Indicates that the server is unwilling to risk processing a request that might be replayed.  <exception>
Upgrade Required: The client should switch to a different protocol.  <exception>
Precondition Required: The origin server requires the request to be conditional.  <exception>
Too Many Requests: The user has sent too many requests in a given amount of time.  <exception>
Request Header Fields Too Large: The server is unwilling to process the request because its header fields are too large.  <exception>
Unavailable For Legal Reasons: The user-agent requested a resource that cannot legally be provided.  <exception>
Internal Server Error: The server has encountered a situation it doesn't know how to handle.  <exception>
Not Implemented: The request method is not supported by the server and cannot be handled.  <exception>
Bad Gateway: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server.  <exception>
Service Unavailable: The server is not ready to handle the request.  <exception>
Gateway Timeout: The server is acting as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a timely response from the upstream server.  <exception>
HTTP Version Not Supported: The HTTP version used in the request is not supported by the server.  <exception>
Variant Also Negotiates: The server has an internal configuration error.  <exception>
Insufficient Storage: The server is unable to store the representation needed to complete the request.  <exception>
Loop Detected: The server detected an infinite loop while processing the request.  <exception>
Not Extended: Further extensions to the request are required for the server to fulfill it.  <exception>
Network Authentication Required: The client needs to authenticate to gain network access.  <exception>
GenericException
Input provided by user is invalid. Please check. <exception>
